channel.title: German Homework Help Please
channel.description:
Hi i have some german homework well what the hell ill just type what it says on the sheet Ex. 1 Unscramble these word snakes
1. hci biele busfalsl 2. cih ibn eien ikenerlln
Ex. 2 Write a short paragraph about Sue when she is older she wants to be a waitress have 2 children get married when she is 25 have a husband named George [hr] Somebody please help as i'm really stuck and this homework is due for tuesday 10th feburary

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Luckily, “will” is German for want, not will.

Read full topic

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Dr_Pepper2 Dr_Pepper
item.description:
@Dr_Pepper2 wrote:

The real question is will Sue have the 2 children before marriage…uh oh is the homework telling us to have kids before we are married…oh yay lol

Read full topic

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I thought it was zwei, it just looked wrong to me. + I suck at spelling.

And yes, I did mean heißt. I posted that at like 10PM.

Read full topic

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Right y’are. “swei jaren” should also be “zwei Jahren” and I’ve never seen namet, I presume he meant heißt.

But he did say that his German wasn’t great, I think it was that more than the fact his parents are Swiss

Read full topic

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:261119”]German is one of the official languages of Switzerland, the widest/largest spoken unless memory fails me.

I know what you’re getting at tho RSC, some of the swiss dialects are what the fuck incomprehensible, (like, for british people, even worse than trying to decipher a geordie - much worse in fact). Swiss Standard isn’t that different though, even I can read it somewhat, and my German is not so great.[/quote]

German is also the official language in Austria, but they speak really different. And that text runescape3dude wrote is understandable, but wrong. For one, it’s ‘zwei’ and not ‘swei’. And ‘wellen’ is ‘wollen’, and because Sue isn’t plural it’s ‘Sue will’.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

German is one of the official languages of Switzerland, the widest/largest spoken unless memory fails me.

I know what you’re getting at tho RSC, some of the swiss dialects are what the fuck incomprehensible, (like, for british people, even worse than trying to decipher a geordie - much worse in fact). Swiss Standard isn’t that different though, even I can read it somewhat, and my German is not so great.

item.title: German Homework Help Please
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Im not sure bout the spelling/grammar but heres a try:

Das ist Sue. Sue wellen studeran zum kellnerin geshaffen. Sue wellen swei kinder gehaben. Sue wellen ein gehochzeit haben auf funthenswanzig jaren zum ein schwollech mahen namet George.

Something like that. My Parents are from Switzerland, but I really suck at german.

Read full topic
